newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: European fuel oil bunkers weaken, buyers back off.
newsitem.headline: European fuel oil bunkers weaken, buyers back off.

text.p: Fuel oil bunker prices in northwest Europe weakened on Monday while those in southern Europe were steady to soft, dealers said.
Rotterdam 380 CST fuel oil was about $1 a tonne down, quoted at around $89/$90. Demand was very low, reducing the level of barge market business to a mere three deals.
Total ARA demand was well under 10,000 tonnes according to many suppliers' estimates.
Hamburg fuel oil bunkers were down, mainly in response to weakness in Rotterdam. However, the losses were limited by some problems with barge availability.
In the Mediterranean, fuel oil bunkers were steady or $1 softer, while gas oil prices came off after last week's fall in benchmark cargo levels.
